We have an internal search for employees which we call AgentSearch. Seems that there should be a way to specify what fields are part of search consideration, at the pipeline level. I have not found any way to do this.</p>\n<p>The only workaround I can think of is to have a duplicate source, because the only way I have found to do this is at the source, not at the pipeline.</p>\n<p>Does any one have a similar situation, and do you have any other way to accomplish this?       "author" : "gviswanath",
      "source" : "AnswersCloud",
      "questionbodyhtml" : "<div class=\"question-body\">\n                <p>Hi,</p> \n<p>We have setup a web crawler index which crawls a few web links. One of the links in the web-crawler index is an xml link(similar to sitemap) which has a list of items that needs to be individually indexed. We have set up the xml document definition to do this xml crawling.</p> \n<p>A sample of the index urls is</p> \n<ul> \n <li><p> <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"http://mysite.com/weblink1\">http://mysite.com/weblink1</a><br></p> </li> \n <li><p> <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"http://mysite.com/weblink2\">http://mysite.com/weblink2</a> </p> </li> \n <li><p> <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"http://mysite.com/items.xml\">http://mysite.com/items.xml</a></p> </li> \n</ul> \n<p>We are facing 2 scenarios in which duplicates are appearing in the search page(built using coveo for sitecore components with the index source set to the above index)</p> \n<p>Scenario 1:</p> \n<p>weblink1 has a link to the page <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"http://mysite.com/page\">http://mysite.com/page</a> and weblink2 has a link to the page <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"http://mysite.com/page.html\">http://mysite.com/page.html</a> (note the extension here). When coveo crawls this page, it creates 2 separate index entries even though they are the same page. This results in duplicates (1 link with the extension and the other link without the extension) in the search results. </p> \n<p>Scenario 2:</p> \n<p>weblink1 has a link to the page <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"http://mysite.com/xmlpage.html\">http://mysite.com/xmlpage.html</a> and the items.xml also has <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"http://mysite.com/xmlpage.html\">http://mysite.com/xmlpage.html</a> as one its items to crawl. This too results in duplicates of xmlpage.html appearing in the search result.</p> \n<p>How do we eliminate the duplicates in these 2 scenarios?</p>\n                </div>",

      "questionbodyhtml" : "<div class=\"question-body\">\n                <p>\n<p>Using Coveo Hive and CfS v4.1.82.12. I have a custom component with a start and end date to filter results, using a custom date field I created. I am trying to figure out how to add the entered date range (start date and/or end date) to the Coveo state and thus the URL query string. Found something at the bottom of this document: <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://developers.coveo.com/display/public/JsSearchV1/State,\">https://developers.coveo.com/display/public/JsSearchV1/State,</a> but a few things:</p>\n<ol> \n <li>Running this code during the afterComponentsInitialization only runs it once on page load then never again after that. So I also added it after the advanced query is updated. </li>\n <li>The code itself adds the attribute correctly to the Coveostate property/object but the URL query string is not updated. </li>\n</ol>\n<p>Code:</p>\n<p>(Note, the hardcoded values in the registerNewAttribute call are for testing)</p> AOPADateRangePickerFacet.prototype.processQueryChange = function (coveoClass) { Coveo.$(this.bindings.searchInterface.element).on(Coveo.QueryEvents.buildingQuery, function (e, args) { var dateField = $(coveoClass.startDateField).closest('div.CoveoAOPADateRangePickerFacet').attr('data-field'); var newDateSet = coveoClass.getNewDateSet(coveoClass); NewDateSet = newDateSet; StartDate = $(coveoClass.startDateField).val(); EndDate = $(coveoClass.endDateField).val();\n<p> \n<pre><code>         // This becomes '@aoparesultdate&gt;=2018/1/1' for example\n         var expressionString = dateField + newDateSet;\n         args.queryBuilder.advancedExpression.add(expressionString);\n     });\n\n     // Update state\n     var searchInterface = coveoClass.bindings.searchInterface.element;\n     if (searchInterface.Coveostate !== undefined) {\n         searchInterface.Coveostate.registerNewAttribute(\"f:@aoparesultdate\", [\":range=[1072936800000,1479358944000]\"]);\n     }\n\n     this.bindings.usageAnalytics.logSearchEvent({\n         name: 'facetSelect',\n         type: 'facet'\n     });\n\n     this.bindings.queryController.executeQuery();\n };</pre>\n</code></pre> \n<p>\n<pre>    AOPADateRangePickerFacet.prototype.registerStateAttribute = function (coveoClass) {\n        Coveo.$(this.bindings.searchInterface.element).on(\"afterComponentsInitialization\", function (e) {\n            coveoClass.bindings.searchInterface.element\n                .Coveostate.registerNewAttribute(\"f:@aoparesultdate\", [\":range=[1072936800000,1479358944000]\"]);\n        });\n    }</pre>\n<p>Both functions are called when the custom component is initialized. </p> \n<p>\n                </div>",
      "sitemaplastmodified" : 1516838400000,

      "questionbodyhtml" : "<div class=\"question-body\">\n                <p>\n<p>Hi,</p>\n<p>I've got a custom component which is adding a suggestion to the omnibox. The suggestion is really a checkbox that, when selected, changes the eventual query that is produced. (Sets a facet or changes the search url, depending on how we end up implementing the options we have). Therefore, I don't want the suggestion to be keyboard selectable, or to have selecting it close the search box.</p>\n<p>This puts the checkbox at the bottom of the suggestions, and (since I'm manually focusing the search input after click) keeps the omnibox open. However, in IE this produces a blip where the omnibox closes and then opens again, which is not ideal. Additionally, the selection is still keyboard selectable, and performs a search for the label's text when I select it with the keyboard and hit enter.</p>\n<p>This is what I currently have: </p>\n<pre>window.Coveo.$$(bindings.root).on(window.Coveo.OmniboxEvents.populateOmniboxSuggestions, function (e, args) {\n    var table = $(\"<table></table>\");\n    var row = $(\"<tr></tr>\");\n    var checkbox = $(\"<input name='omni-checkbox' type='checkbox'></input>\");\n    checkbox.attr(\"checked\", checked);\n    var label = $(\"<label for='omni-checkbox'>Restrict</label>\");\n    row.append(checkbox);\n    row.append(label);\n    row.addClass(\"coveo-omnibox-selectable\");\n    row.on(\"click\",\n        function () {\n            checked = !checked;\n            $(this).find(\"input[type='checkbox']\").attr(\"checked\", checked);\n            $($(\"#header-search-box input\").get(0)).focus();\n        });\n    table.append(row);\n    args.suggestions.push(new Promise(function (resolve) {\n        resolve([\n            {\n                index: -1,\n                dom: table[0]\n            }\n        ]);\n    }));\n});\n</pre> \n<p>\n                </div>",

ISearchboxOptions\n    } from 'coveo-search-ui';\nimport * as $ from 'jquery';\nexport class SearchboxExtended extends Coveo.Searchbox {\n    static ID = 'SearchboxExtended';\n    constructor(public element: HTMLElement, options: ISearchboxOptions, bindings: IComponentBindings) {\n        super(element, options, bindings);\n        this.bind.onRootElement(InitializationEvents.afterComponentsInitialization, () => this.afterComponentsInitialization());\n    }\n    private afterComponentsInitialization() {\n        var $searchbox = $(this.element), $input =  $searchbox.find(\"input\");\n        if ( $input.length) {\n            var $megamenu = $(\".search-mega\"), $button = $searchbox.find(\".CoveoSearchButton\");\n            // Show Search\n            $input.on(\"focus\", function() {\n                $megamenu.addClass(\"active\");\n            });\n            $megamenu.find(\".close\").on(\"click\", function() {\n                $megamenu.removeClass(\"active\");\n            });\n        }\n    }\n}\nInitialization.registerAutoCreateComponent(SearchboxExtended);\n</pre>\n<p>As you can see, its just inheriting from the base class and adding an extra event handler.</p>\n<p>The problem is that on the front end, this results in TWO searchboxes being rendered, like this</p>\n<pre><div.CoveoExtended.CoveoSearchbox>\n    <a.CoveoSearchButton/>\n    <div.CoveoOmnibox/>\n    <a.CoveoSearchButton/>\n    <div.CoveoOmnibox/>\n</div></pre>\n<p>If I change my div class back to \"CoveoSearchbox\", or if I use composition to extend Searchbox, then the front end renders one searchbox, as expected. This is very confusing behavior, can you please shed some light on how to inherit from Searchbox without causing duplication of html?</p> \n<p>\n                </div>",

      "questionbodyhtml" : "<div class=\"question-body\">\n                <p>\n<p>I have been experiencing a problem when new bucket items are created where the Coveo Seach results show the title and abstract from our 404 page. We have a custom LinkProvider to create user-friendly links for our bucket items. Therefore, we also have a custom Resolver to return the correct item for the URLs generated by our custom LinkProvider. Here are a few details:</p>\n<p><strong>LinkProvider:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n <li>Strips the \"bucket\" generated folders from the URL.</li>\n</ul>\n<p><strong>Resolver:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n <li>Takes the item name at the end of the URL and uses a search against the sitecore_web_index to retrieve the item.</li>\n</ul>\n<p><strong>Sitecore Indexes:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n <li>The sitecore_*_indexes are using Azure Search (we are in a PaaS set-up)</li>\n</ul>\n<p><strong>Symptoms:</strong></p>\n<p>When new bucket items are created and publish, they show up in the Coveo results with the title \"Not Found\" and the search abstract is from our 404 page.</p>\n<p><strong>Current Workaround:</strong></p>\n<p>When we simply rebuild the Coveo Index, the incorrect data is fixed and the Coveo results reflect the actual title and abstract details.</p>\n<p><strong>Suspected Root Cause:</strong></p>\n<p>There may be a delay in when the siteore_web_index is updated with the new items and when the Coveo Index tries to call the ClickableURI to get the HTML.</p>\n<p><strong>Question:</strong></p>\n<p><strong><em>Can we customize the crawler to use the full Sitecore path to get the HTML rather than the clickableURI? </em></strong>This will eliminate the dependency on the sitecore_web_index since the request would not need to go through the custom resolver.</p> \n<p>\n                </div>",

      "questionbodyhtml" : "<div class=\"question-body\">\n                <p>\n<p>The beginning of Coveo.ResultList.handleQuerySuccess looks like this. As you can see, the value of this.reachedEndOfResults is being explicitly set to false. This causes this.reachedEndOfResults to sometimes have incorrect value.</p>\n<pre>private handleQuerySuccess(data: IQuerySuccessEventArgs) {\n    Assert.exists(data);\n    Assert.exists(data.results);\n    let results = data.results;\n    this.logger.trace('Received query results from new query', results);\n    this.hideWaitingAnimation();\n    ResultList.resultCurrentlyBeingRendered = undefined;\n    this.currentlyDisplayedResults = [];\n    this.renderResults(this.buildResults(data.results));\n    this.currentlyDisplayedResults = results.results;\n    this.reachedTheEndOfResults = false;\n</pre>\n<p>Why isn't it something like...</p>\n<pre>this.reachedTheEndOfResults = data.results.results.length >= data.results.totalCount;</pre>\n<p>What I am trying to implement is a \"Load More\" button. To determine whether the button should be visible, I check the ResultList.hasPotentiallyMoreResultsToDisplay() function. However, sometimes it gives the wrong value due to the problem described above.</p>\n<p>Is this expected behavior or a bug?</p> \n<p>\n                </div>",

However, let's say I have an item in sitecore with multiple tags and I want to find related items based on these tags in coveo index. I was trying to implement it in LINQ query but I stuck. I'm looking for something like this, but for multivalue field:</p>\n<pre>var results = new List<SearchResultItem>();\n            using (var context = CoveoExtensions.GetCoveoIndex().CreateSearchContext())\n            {\n                var queryable = context.GetQueryable<SearchResultItem>()\n                    .Where(x => x.TemplateId == BlogPostPageTemplateId ||\n                                x.TemplateId == ResourcePageTemplateId)\n                    .OrderByDescending(x => x.GetDateFieldValue(\"commoditypublishdate\"))\n                    .Take(maximumItems);\n                results = queryable.ToList();\n            }\n            return results;\n</pre>\n<p>Does anybody have idea how I can achieve that with LINQ?</p>\n<p>Thanks a lot,</p>\n<p>Alexander.</p> \n<p>\n                </div>",

      "questionbodyhtml" : "<div class=\"question-body\">\n                <p>\n<p>I need Coveo to ignore the <footer> section of my HTML pages. Any suggestions how to do it?</p>\n<p>Found this, but it is specific to Sitecore: </p>\n<p><a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://developers.coveo.com/display/public/SitecoreV4/Ignoring+Specific+HTML+Sections+from+an+Item+Body\">https://developers.coveo.com/display/public/SitecoreV4/Ignoring+Specific+HTML+Sections+from+an+Item+Body</a></p>\n<p>And someone told me to create a Field with a Custom Script that extracts the <footer> section in PostConversion (I also tried PrecConversion), and that doesn't work either. If it helps, this is the script I used:</p>\n<pre>try {\n  //HTML page\n  var UTF8_CHARSET = 2;\n  var documentContent =  PostConversion.HTMLOutput.ReadByteString(PostConversion.HTMLOutput.BytesCount,UTF8_CHARSET);\n  //regex - Page Footer\n  var regexFooter = /<footer[\\s\\S]*?<\\/footer>/ig;\n  //Cleanup HTML page by removing the footer from the search results\n  var documentContentCleanHTML = documentContent.replace(regexFooter, \"\");\n  //Set final content\n  PostConversion.HTMLOutputToOverride.WriteString(documentContentCleanHTML);\n}\ncatch(err) {\n  PostConversion.Trace(\"Error: \" + err.description,2);\n}\n</pre>\n<p>Any suggestions how to do this in Cloud v1?</p> \n<p>\n                </div>",

The problem we're experiencing is when you select what would be the parent it will also check off all of the children. This in turn causes the breadcrumb to list every child option which creates a long list of breadcrumbs. The client is not happy with this and wishes to only show the parent as selected with only that item in the bread crumbs.</p>\n<p>To furthur illustrate the problem lets say we have an item in Sitecore called cars. That item houses numerous car types and then each of those will house the individual cars of those types.</p>\n<p>For example, lets say we have this structure inside of Sitecore</p>\n<pre>Cars/\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 Sports Cars/\n\u2502   \u251c\u2500\u2500 Ford Mustang\n\u2502   \u251c\u2500\u2500 Porche 911\n\u2502   \u251c\u2500\u2500 370Z\n\u2502   \u2514\u2500\u2500 GT-R\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 SUVs/\n\u2502   \u251c\u2500\u2500 Jeep Patriot\n\u2502   \u2514\u2500\u2500 Jeep Renegade\n\u2514\u2500\u2500 Vans/\n    \u251c\u2500\u2500 Sprinter\n    \u2514\u2500\u2500 Cube Van\n    \u2514\u2500\u2500 Caravan\n</pre>\n<p>This in turn creates a similar structure in our Car facet. If a user expands cars then SUVs and selects Jeep Patriot only that item is checked and only that item appears in the breadcrumb. If instead they were to expand Cars and select SUVs it would also select all the SUVs giving you all three items in the breadcrumb. This doesn't look terrible in our above example data however in production there are dozens if not hundreds of child items which can create massive breadcrumbs.</p>\n<p>Is there any way to override this logic so that only the parent is selected and in turn only that one selection appears in the breadcrumb?</p>\n<p>Thank you</p> \n<p>\n                </div>",

newResultsDisplayed, userType: ' + userType);\n     });\n</code></pre> \n<p>} </p>\n                </div>",

But when come back to our search results page and click on search button, changes are not reflecting immediately. This is working fine if we use other browser or in other user machine. </p>\n<p>We suspect if there is any in-built caching being applied to search view. Nivelación de Datos.Ficheros ITA e IDC\" /></pre>\n<p>After waiting for Rebuilding source and watching in logs browser if the document had been recrawled we found out that the \"description\" field didn't appeared at all in the \"Content Browser\" for that url.</p>\n<p>If I create an explicit mapping rule in the Source config section in the way:</p>\n<pre>Map description with %[description]</pre>\n<p>Then a successful mapping is done, but I would like to reduce the efforts in mapping metadata.</p>\n<p>Have you faced this situation? <br>Is there something I am missing? <br>And at last is there any way to map all the metadata without defining every field, regardless the name and number of metadata in the source html?</p>\n<p>Thanks!!!</p> \n<p>\n                </div>",

How come this logic does not apply to sliders? Like when a facet selection is made, the facet slider range should also change based on result set, but, it seems like currently the min/max are still per initial load which I think is grabbed from index. </p>\n<p>This is not intuitive, also the min/max does not seem to consider initial query fired by Coveo view to compute that min/max and is run against the whole index. Kind of becomes not so useful in use cases where were are not worried about that field's value across index and would rather need based on result set. </p>\n<p>How can we approach this? Any thoughts or input? Could not find much information on this on Coveo documentation either, played with some advanced settings, but, this behavior is not affected. </p> \n<p>\n                </div>",

      "questionbodyhtml" : "<div class=\"question-body\">\n                <p>\n<p>I am creating custom filtering rule condition that need to check that field value is in a list of allowed values.</p>\n<p>Condition works in general but I am stuck trying to return \"In\" condition or join multiple equal conditions by \"or\". There is \"CoveoIn\" extension method in CoveoQueryableExtensions class, but I could not find documentation for usage.</p>\n<p>The skeleton of my class is below:</p>\n<pre>public class ValueInListCondition<TContext> : WhenCondition<TContext>, ICoveoCondition<TContext> where TContext : RuleContext\n    {\n        public string FieldName { get; set; }\n        public Expression GetQueryExpression(ConditionContext context)\n        {\n            var allowedValues = GetAllowedValues();\n            Expression readNameProperty = GetFieldIndexerExpression(context.ParameterExpression, FieldName);\n            return Expression.Call(typeof(CoveoQueryableExtensions), \"CoveoIn\", null, new Expression[2]\n            {\n                readNameProperty,\n                //??? - what should be passed here as argumets ???\n            });\n        }\n        public void ValidateCondition(ErrorReport report)\n        {\n        }\n        public RuleCondition<TContext> GetWrappedCondition()\n        {\n            return this;\n        }\n        protected override bool Execute(TContext ruleContext)\n        {\n            return true;\n        }\n        Expression GetFieldIndexerExpression(ParameterExpression p_Instance, string p_FieldName)\n        {\n            string indexerPropertyName = \"Item\";\n            // By default the indexer corresponds to the \"Item\" property, but one can change it.\n            // In order to find the name, if modified, we must search for DefaultMemberAttribute attribute.\n            // Fortunately, only one indexer name can be defined.\n            object[] attributes = p_Instance.Type.GetCustomAttributes(typeof(DefaultMemberAttribute), true);\n            if (attributes.Any())\n            {\n                indexerPropertyName = (attributes[0] as DefaultMemberAttribute).MemberName;\n            }\n            PropertyInfo indexerProperty = p_Instance.Type.GetProperty(indexerPropertyName,\n                                                                       new Type[] { typeof(string) });\n            MethodInfo indexerGetMethod = indexerProperty.GetMethod;\n            Expression callIndexerExpression = Expression.Call(p_Instance,\n                                                               indexerGetMethod,\n                                                               Expression.Constant(p_FieldName));\n            return callIndexerExpression;\n        }\n        private List<string> GetAllowedValues()\n        {\n            return new List<string> { \"123\", \"234\", \"456\" };\n        }\n    }</pre>\n<p>Can someone please help figure out which arguments need to be passed to \"CoveoIn\" expression?</p> \n<p>\n                </div>",

Is there a way to override this behavior and maintain the sort order we have setup?</p>\n<p>I see the below on group by in request headers, assuming this is default behavior when the value is in allowed values </p>\n<p>groupBy: \"allowedValues\":[\"2011\"] (Example of what I see on allowed values when url for example is <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"http://www.domain.com/pagename#f:articlePostYear=[2011\">www.domain.com/pagename#f:articlePostYear=[2011</a>]</p> \n<p>\n                </div>",

      "questionbodyhtml" : "<div class=\"question-body\">\n                <p>\n<p>Our Sitecore pages consist of multiple renderings. Each rendering uses separate data source item (other than page itself) of specific template. This way renderings can be easily reused/added/removed on pages.</p>\n<p>Each data source item is indexed as a separate document in Coveo index. However, we need to see the page where rendering is used instead of data source item in the search results.</p>\n<p>As the first step, we used CoveoPostItemProcessingPipeline to override Title and ClickUri for rendering data source items with Title and Uri of the appropriate page item. That part worked well.</p>\n<p>Now, if content of multiple renderings on the page matches the search criteria we get this page in the search result multiple times. The plan was to use pipeline on the Coveo Search API side to merge results that belong to the same page. However, there is limitation that this pipeline allow to manipulate only one page of the result set (see my previous question: <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://answers.coveo.com/questions/11794/removing-merging-query-results-using-coveo-search.html%29.\">https://answers.coveo.com/questions/11794/removing-merging-query-results-using-coveo-search.html).</a></p>\n<p>Right now I am looking into folding results and trying to see if the feature can be used here.</p>\n<p>Any other suggestions for solution?</p> \n<p>\n                </div>",

(Fault Detail is equal to An ExceptionDetail, likely<br></code></p>\n<p><code> created by IncludeExceptionDetailInFaults=true, whose value is: <br></code></p>\n<p><code>System.Runtime.InteropServices.COMException: The admin is not connected to the service. <br></code></p>\n<p><code> at Coveo.CES.Interops.CESAdmin.AdminClass.get_PhysicalIndex() <br></code></p>\n<p><code>at Coveo.CES.AdminService.CesInformation.CesAdminWrapper.get_PhysicalIndex() <br></code></p>\n<p><code>at Coveo.CES.AdminService.AdminService.GetCollectionNames(CesMasterInformation p_Info) <br></code></p>\n<p><code>at SyncInvokeGetCollectionNames(Object , Object[] , Object[] ) <br></code></p>\n<p><code>at System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.SyncMethodInvoker.Invoke(Object instance, Object[] inputs, Object[]& outputs) <br></code></p>\n<p><code>at System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.DispatchOperationRuntime.InvokeBegin(MessageRpc& rpc) <br></code></p>\n<p><code>at System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ImmutableDispatchRuntime.ProcessMessage5(MessageRpc& rpc) <br></code></p>\n<p><code>at System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ImmutableDispatchRuntime.ProcessMessage31(MessageRpc& rpc) <br></code></p>\n<p><code>at System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.MessageRpc.Process(Boolean isOperationContextSet)).</code> </p>\n<p>The admin service reports the same error. In the Sitecore logs, we see errors such as</p>\n<pre>Exception: Coveo.Framework.Utils.Rest.HttpClientException<br>Message: Failed to obtain resource located at 'http://www.subzero-wolf.com/coveo/rest?indexName=Coveo_pub_index'.<br>[BEGIN RESPONSE BODY]{\"statusCode\":408,\"message\":\"Server is unavailable: (not specified,null)\",\"type\":\"ServerUnavailableException\" (full exception details attached <a href=\"/storage/attachments/154-coveo-exception.txt\">coveo-exception.txt</a>).</pre>\n<p>All services are running. When I try to access the admin panel I get the Initial Setup screen, which is strange since we already have indexes set up. Additionally I checked the following:</p>\n<ul> \n <li>Secret key in config.yml matches the key in our custom rest config</li>\n <li>Certificate paths in config.yml are correct and certificates exist there</li>\n</ul>\n<p>We are using Coveo Enterprise Search 7.0 x64 Build 8691.0, Coveo Search API 8 FIleVersion 8.0.1130.0 and Coveo for Sitecore version 4.0.895.0.</p>\n<p>Thanks,</p>\n<p>Paul</p> \n<p>\n                </div>",

Per the info on this page: (some items are listed more than once, which seems a bit redundant</p> \n<p>Query Count: This metric is simply the total number of queries for the specified dimensions and filters.</p> \n<p>Manual Query Count: This metric is the total number of queries performed by users (using the search box) for the specified dimensions and filters.</p> \n<p>Refined Query Count: This metric is the number of query refinements done by users (facets, interface change, etc.) for the specified dimensions and filters.</p> \n<p>Reading these definitions one might logically assume that query count is the total, and it is equal to the manual queries plus the refined queries. </p> \n<p>But, none of the out of the box reports have the numbers for these three that add up as such. Why is the query count not equal to the sum of manual plus refined? What other types of queries are there, and why are these not showing up in the reports in a proper bucket/grouping so that the data makes sense and adds up? </p> \n<p>There should be another bucket that includes the grouping of the extra ones that do not fit in the manual or refined buckets (my GUESS is the rest are ones done in code or behind the scenes somehow not done directly by the user typing or clicking). </p>\n                </div>",
